Name: Weaknesses in the 2025 CWE Most Important Hardware Weaknesses List
Objective:
CWE entries in this view are listed in
            the 2025 CWE Most Important Hardware Weaknesses List, as
            determined by the Hardware CWE Special Interest Group (HW
            CWE SIG). The 2025 MIHW aims to drive awareness of
            critical hardware weaknesses and provide the cybersecurity
            community with practical guidance to prevent security
            issues at the source. By combining advanced data analysis
            with expert consensus, the list helps organizations
            prioritize mitigations, strengthen design practices, and
            make informed decisions throughout the hardware
            lifecycle.

Audience.Description: Address key security weaknesses during hardware design process.
Evaluate products for critical security weaknesses and enforce supplier security standards.
Investigate selected weaknesses and develop new mitigation strategies.
Identify gaps in foundational security models to develop advanced approaches.
Focus testing on high-priority hardware security weaknesses.
Improve automated tools to detect critical security weaknesses.
Structure course content and research projects around hardware security weaknesses.

MappingNotes.Rationale: This entry is a View. Views are not weaknesses and therefore inappropriate to describe the root causes of vulnerabilities.
MappingNotes.Comments: Use this View or other Views to search and navigate for the appropriate weakness.

ContentHistory.ContributionComment: Helped the CWE Team to define methodology and scoring algorithms; performed data analysis and mappings for Weakness Data Collection (WDC); and/or participated in Expert Poll 1 (EP1) or Expert Poll 2 (EP2).
